name.description: Display name. Data collected from different sources like moderation lists, dns, collections names and over.

AccountEvent.description: An event is built on top of a trace which is a series of transactions caused by one inbound message. TonAPI looks for known patterns inside the trace and splits the trace into actions, where a single action represents a meaningful high-level operation like a Jetton Transfer or an NFT Purchase. Actions are expected to be shown to users. It is advised not to build any logic on top of actions because actions can be changed at any time.

in_progress.description: Event is not finished yet. Transactions still happening

ActionSimplePreview.description: shortly describes what this action is about.

action_image.description: a link to an image for this particular action.

value_image.description: a link to an image that depicts this action's asset.

10.description: List of critical TON parameters, the change of which significantly affects the network, so more voting rounds are held.

11.description: This parameter indicates under what conditions proposals to change the TON configuration are accepted.

13.description: The cost of filing complaints about incorrect operation of validators.

14.description: The reward in nanoTons for block creation in the TON blockchain.

15.description: The reward in nanoTons for block creation in the TON blockchain.

16.description: The limits on the number of validators in the TON blockchain.

17.description: The stake parameters configuration in the TON blockchain.

20.description: The cost of computations in the masterchain. The complexity of any computation is estimated in gas units.

21.description: The cost of computations in the basechains. The complexity of any computation is estimated in gas units.

22.description: The limits on the block in the masterchain, upon reaching which the block is finalized and the callback of the remaining messages (if any) is carried over to the next block.

23.description: The limits on the block in the basechains, upon reaching which the block is finalized and the callback of the remaining messages (if any) is carried over to the next block.

24.description: The cost of sending messages in the masterchain of the TON blockchain.

25.description: The cost of sending messages in the basechains of the TON blockchain.

28.description: The configuration for the Catchain protocol.

29.description: The configuration for the consensus protocol above catchain.

3.description: The address of the transaction fee collector.

31.description: The configuration for the consensus protocol above catchain.

40.description: The configuration for punishment for improper behavior (non-validation). In the absence of the parameter, the default fine size is 101 TON

43.description: The size limits and some other characteristics of accounts and messages.

info.description: Provide access to indexed TON blockchain
info.title: REST api to TON blockchain explorer

post.description: Get human-friendly information about several accounts without low-level details.

get.description: Get human-friendly information about an account without low-level details.

Get events for an account. Each event is built on top of a trace which is a series of transactions caused by one inbound message. TonAPI looks for known patterns inside the trace and splits the trace into actions, where a single action represents a meaningful high-level operation like a Jetton Transfer or an NFT Purchase. Actions are expected to be shown to users. It is advised not to build any logic on top of actions because actions can be changed at any time.

parameters.name: before_lt

schema.description:
Supported values:
"NaN" for NaN type, 
"Null" for Null type, 
10-base digits for tiny int type (Example: 100500), 
0x-prefixed hex digits for int257 (Example: 0xfa01d78381ae32), 
all forms of addresses for slice type (Example: 0:6e731f2e28b73539a7f85ac47ca104d5840b229351189977bb6151d36b5e3f5e), 
single-root base64-encoded BOC for cell (Example: "te6ccgEBAQEAAgAAAA=="),
single-root hex-encoded BOC for slice (Example: b5ee9c72010101010002000000)

get.description: Get all blocks in all shards and workchains between target and previous masterchain block according to shards last blocks snapshot in masterchain.  We don't recommend to build your app around this method because it has problem with scalability and will work very slow in the future.
Get blockchain config from a specific block, if present.
Get raw blockchain config from a specific block, if present.

Get all transactions in all shards and workchains between target and previous masterchain block according to shards last blocks snapshot in masterchain. We don't recommend to build your app around this method because it has problem with scalability and will work very slow in the future.
Get transaction data by message hash
Get full information about domain name

Get an event either by event ID or a hash of any transaction in a trace. An event is built on top of a trace which is a series of transactions caused by one inbound message. TonAPI looks for known patterns inside the trace and splits the trace into actions, where a single action represents a meaningful high-level operation like a Jetton Transfer or an NFT Purchase. Actions are expected to be shown to users. It is advised not to build any logic on top of actions because actions can be changed at any time.
Get only jetton transfers in the event
Get all inscriptions by owner address. It's experimental API and can be dropped in the future.
Get the transfer inscriptions history for account. It's experimental API and can be dropped in the future.
